clinical_study.brief_title: VAlidity and Reliability of the Telephone Interview Form for Stroke Outcome Evaluation
clinical_study.official_title: Development and Validation of the Telephone Interview Form for Stroke Outcome

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators developed a telephone interview form as a simple questionnaire with the original combination of Barthel Index and modified Rankin Scale. The main purpose of this study is to evaluate validity and reliability of the telephone interview form when compared with face-to-face assessment in clinically stable patients with stroke.

detailed_description.textblock:
The Barthel Index (BI) and modified Rankin Scale (mRS) have been widely used in stroke outcome assessment. The dimensionality of mRS is wider than BI while BI detailedly reveals the activity of daily living of patients. The content of these two scales are partly repeated as a result of intra-logical order.
Besides, the information of patients could be obtained by means of application of telephone follow-up in clinical trials. It also could guarantee the blinding and agreement of rater.
Therefore, the investigators developed a telephone interview form as a simple questionnaire with the original combination of BI and mRS. What's more, the investigators conduct this diagnostic test to evaluate validity and reliability of the telephone interview form when compared with face-to-face assessment in clinically stable patients with stroke.

primary_outcome.measure: Validity of the Telephone Interview Form
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Score change from baseline TIF at 3 days after baseline, Score change from baseline TIF at 6 days after baseline
primary_outcome.description: The agreement between the Telephone Interview Form (TIF) and face-to-face assessment.

primary_outcome.measure: Reliability of the Telephone Interview Form
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 days after baseline, Score change from 3 days after baseline TIF at 6 days after baseline
primary_outcome.description: The agreement of the Telephone Interview Form (TIF) when administrated by two different rates.

intervention.description: Telephone Interview Form is an original simple questionnaire which consists of Barthel Index and modified Rankin Scale.

study_pop.textblock: The study population are stable patients with stroke with the course of 1 to 12 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a diagnosis of ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke.
- The course of 1 to 12 months.
- Patient or procuratorial caregiver has a good understanding so as to answer rater's telephone interview.
- Patient or legally authorized representative has signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients suffer from psychological or mental disorders.
- Patients suffer from other so severe diseases that they can't complete the follow-up.
